nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -536,6 +542,13 @@ To grow the amount of shards in an index.
 See the {ref}/indices-split-index.html[split index API].
 // end::split-def[]
 
+[[glossary-system-index]] system index ::
+// tag::hidden-index-def[]

nodes.bodyText: One minor point that it might be good to mention here: Hidden indices are also included for wildcard expressions that start with a dot, e.g. .watcher-history*. This was done in part to mirror the Unix globbing behavior for dot files, and in part because indices that start with a dot must be either hidden or system indices in 8.0+.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -188,6 +188,12 @@ Frozen indices use a memory-efficient shard implementation and throttle searches
 Searching a frozen index is lower overhead than re-opening a closed index to enable searching.
 // end::frozen-index-def[]
 
+[[glossary-hidden-index]] hidden index ::
+// tag::hidden-index-def[]
+An index that is excluded by default when you access indices using a wildcard expression. 
+To include hidden indices, you must specify the `expand_wildcards` parameter.

nodes.bodyText: I'm not sure if this is relevant because I'm not sure what branches this is aimed at, but this will only be true for 8.0+, for 7.x you can access/modify system indices, but doing so is deprecated.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -536,6 +542,13 @@ To grow the amount of shards in an index.
 See the {ref}/indices-split-index.html[split index API].
 // end::split-def[]
 
+[[glossary-system-index]] system index ::
+// tag::hidden-index-def[]
+An index that contains configuration information or other data used internally by the system, 
+such as the `.security` index
+You cannot directly access or modify system indices.
